trans-unit.source: Deploy an application with Azure Resource Manager Template
trans-unit.target: Deploy an application with Azure Resource Manager Template

trans-unit.source: Use Azure Resource Manager to deploy an application to Azure. A template is a JSON file and can be used from the Portal, PowerShell, the Azure Command-Line Interface for Mac, Linux, and Windows, or REST.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Resource Manager to deploy an application to Azure. A template is a JSON file and can be used from the Portal, PowerShell, the Azure Command-Line Interface for Mac, Linux, and Windows, or REST.

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to use Azure Resource Manager templates to deploy your application to Azure.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to use Azure Resource Manager templates to deploy your application to Azure.

trans-unit.source: It shows how deploy your application by using either Azure PowerShell, Azure CLI, REST API, or the Microsoft Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: It shows how deploy your application by using either Azure PowerShell, Azure CLI, REST API, or the Microsoft Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager templates enable you to quickly and easily provision your applications in Azure via declarative JSON.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager templates enable you to quickly and easily provision your applications in Azure via declarative JSON.

trans-unit.source: In a single JSON template, you can deploy multiple services, such as Virtual Machines, Virtual Networks, Storage, App Services, and databases.
trans-unit.target: In a single JSON template, you can deploy multiple services, such as Virtual Machines, Virtual Networks, Storage, App Services, and databases.

trans-unit.source: You use the same template to repeatedly and consistently deploy your application during every stage of the application lifecycle.
trans-unit.target: You use the same template to repeatedly and consistently deploy your application during every stage of the application lifecycle.

trans-unit.source: To simplify management of your application, you can organize all of the resources that share a common lifecycle into a single resource group.
trans-unit.target: To simplify management of your application, you can organize all of the resources that share a common lifecycle into a single resource group.

trans-unit.source: Resource groups make it easy to deploy, update, and delete all of the related resources together.
trans-unit.target: Resource groups make it easy to deploy, update, and delete all of the related resources together.

trans-unit.source: In most cases, a resource group maps to either a single application or an application tier (for large applications).
trans-unit.target: In most cases, a resource group maps to either a single application or an application tier (for large applications).

trans-unit.source: The resource deployed through a template will reside within a single resource groups, but they can include dependencies in other resource groups.
trans-unit.target: The resource deployed through a template will reside within a single resource groups, but they can include dependencies in other resource groups.

trans-unit.source: Within a resource group, you can track the execution of a deployment, and see the status of the deployment and any output from template execution.
trans-unit.target: Within a resource group, you can track the execution of a deployment, and see the status of the deployment and any output from template execution.

trans-unit.source: When deploying an application with a template, you can provide parameter values to customize how the resources are created.
trans-unit.target: When deploying an application with a template, you can provide parameter values to customize how the resources are created.

trans-unit.source: You specify values for these parameters either inline or in a parameter file.
trans-unit.target: You specify values for these parameters either inline or in a parameter file.

trans-unit.source: Resource Group - collection of entities that share a common lifecycle
trans-unit.target: Resource Group - collection of entities that share a common lifecycle

trans-unit.source: Resource Manager Template - declarative JSON file that defines the goal state of a deployment
trans-unit.target: Resource Manager Template - declarative JSON file that defines the goal state of a deployment

trans-unit.source: Deployment - operation which tracks execution of a Resource Manager template
trans-unit.target: Deployment - operation which tracks execution of a Resource Manager template

trans-unit.source: Parameters - values provided by the user executing the deployment to customize deployed resources
trans-unit.target: Parameters - values provided by the user executing the deployment to customize deployed resources

trans-unit.source: Parameter file - JSON file that stores parameter names and values
trans-unit.target: Parameter file - JSON file that stores parameter names and values

trans-unit.source: With Resource Manager templates, you can:
trans-unit.target: With Resource Manager templates, you can:

trans-unit.source: Deploy complex multitier applications, such as Microsoft SharePoint.
trans-unit.target: Deploy complex multitier applications, such as Microsoft SharePoint.

trans-unit.source: Consistently and repeatedly deploy your applications.
trans-unit.target: Consistently and repeatedly deploy your applications.

trans-unit.source: Support dev, test, and production environments.
trans-unit.target: Support dev, test, and production environments.

trans-unit.source: View the status of deployments.
trans-unit.target: View the status of deployments.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot deployment failures using deployment audit logs.
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot deployment failures using deployment audit logs.

trans-unit.source: Guess what?
trans-unit.target: Guess what?

trans-unit.source: Every application that you create through the <linkText>preview portal</linkText><title></title> is backed by an Azure Resource Manager template!
trans-unit.target: Every application that you create through the <linkText>preview portal</linkText><title></title> is backed by an Azure Resource Manager template!

trans-unit.source: By simply creating a Virtual Machine, Virtual Network, Storage Account, App Service, or database through the portal, you're already reaping the benefits of Azure Resource Manager without additional effort.
trans-unit.target: By simply creating a Virtual Machine, Virtual Network, Storage Account, App Service, or database through the portal, you're already reaping the benefits of Azure Resource Manager without additional effort.

trans-unit.source: Simply, select the New icon and you will be on your way toward deploying an application through Azure Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: Simply, select the New icon and you will be on your way toward deploying an application through Azure Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For more information about using the portal with Azure Resource Manager, see <linkText>Using the Azure Preview Portal to manage your Azure resources</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about using the portal with Azure Resource Manager, see <linkText>Using the Azure Preview Portal to manage your Azure resources</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you have not previously used Azure PowerShell with Resource Manager, see <linkText>Using Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you have not previously used Azure PowerShell with Resource Manager, see <linkText>Using Azure PowerShell with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Login to your Azure account.
trans-unit.target: Login to your Azure account.

trans-unit.source: After providing your credentials, the command returns information about your account.
trans-unit.target: After providing your credentials, the command returns information about your account.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple subscriptions, provide the subscription id you wish to use for deployment.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple subscriptions, provide the subscription id you wish to use for deployment.

trans-unit.source: Switch to the Azure Resource Manager module.
trans-unit.target: Switch to the Azure Resource Manager module.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have an existing resource group, create a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have an existing resource group, create a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: Provide the name of the resource group and location that you need for your solution.
trans-unit.target: Provide the name of the resource group and location that you need for your solution.

trans-unit.source: A summary of the new resource group is returned.
trans-unit.target: A summary of the new resource group is returned.

trans-unit.source: To create a new deployment for your resource group, run the New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment command and provide the necessary parameters.
trans-unit.target: To create a new deployment for your resource group, run the New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment command and provide the necessary parameters.

trans-unit.source: The parameters will include a name for your deployment, the name of your resource group, the path or URL to the template you created, and any other parameters needed for your scenario.
trans-unit.target: The parameters will include a name for your deployment, the name of your resource group, the path or URL to the template you created, and any other parameters needed for your scenario.

trans-unit.source: You have the following options for providing parameter values:
trans-unit.target: You have the following options for providing parameter values:

trans-unit.source: Use inline parameters.
trans-unit.target: Use inline parameters.

trans-unit.source: Use a parameter object.
trans-unit.target: Use a parameter object.

trans-unit.source: Using a parameter file.
trans-unit.target: Using a parameter file.

trans-unit.source: For information about the template file, see <linkText>Parameter file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about the template file, see <linkText>Parameter file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: When the resource group has been deployed, you will see a summary of the deployment.
trans-unit.target: When the resource group has been deployed, you will see a summary of the deployment.

trans-unit.source: DeploymentName : ExampleDeployment ResourceGroupName : ExampleResourceGroup ProvisioningState : Succeeded Timestamp : 4/14/2015 7:00:27 PM Mode : Incremental ...
trans-unit.target: DeploymentName : ExampleDeployment ResourceGroupName : ExampleResourceGroup ProvisioningState : Succeeded Timestamp : 4/14/2015 7:00:27 PM Mode : Incremental ...

trans-unit.source: To get information about deployment failures.
trans-unit.target: To get information about deployment failures.

trans-unit.source: To get detailed information about deployment failures.
trans-unit.target: To get detailed information about deployment failures.

trans-unit.source: Here's a video demonstrating working with Resource Manager templates with PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Here's a video demonstrating working with Resource Manager templates with PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.VIDEO deploy-an-application-with-azure-resource-manager-template]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.VIDEO deploy-an-application-with-azure-resource-manager-template]

trans-unit.source: If you have not previously used Azure CLI with Resource Manager, see <linkText>Using the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows with Azure Resource Management</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you have not previously used Azure CLI with Resource Manager, see <linkText>Using the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows with Azure Resource Management</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Login to your Azure account.
trans-unit.target: Login to your Azure account.

trans-unit.source: After providing your credentials, the command returns the result of your login.
trans-unit.target: After providing your credentials, the command returns the result of your login.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple subscriptions, provide the subscription id you wish to use for deployment.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple subscriptions, provide the subscription id you wish to use for deployment.

trans-unit.source: Switch to Azure Resource Manager module.
trans-unit.target: Switch to Azure Resource Manager module.

trans-unit.source: You will receive confirmation of the new mode.
trans-unit.target: You will receive confirmation of the new mode.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have an existing resource group, create a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have an existing resource group, create a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: Provide the name of the resource group and location that you need for your solution.
trans-unit.target: Provide the name of the resource group and location that you need for your solution.

trans-unit.source: A summary of the new resource group is returned.
trans-unit.target: A summary of the new resource group is returned.

trans-unit.source: To create a new deployment for your resource group, run the following command and provide the necessary parameters.
trans-unit.target: To create a new deployment for your resource group, run the following command and provide the necessary parameters.

trans-unit.source: The parameters will include a name for your deployment, the name of your resource group, the path or URL to the template you created, and any other parameters needed for your scenario.
trans-unit.target: The parameters will include a name for your deployment, the name of your resource group, the path or URL to the template you created, and any other parameters needed for your scenario.

trans-unit.source: You have the following options for providing parameter values:
trans-unit.target: You have the following options for providing parameter values:

trans-unit.source: Use inline parameters and a local template.
trans-unit.target: Use inline parameters and a local template.

trans-unit.source: Use inline parameters and a link to a template.
trans-unit.target: Use inline parameters and a link to a template.

trans-unit.source: Use a parameter file.
trans-unit.target: Use a parameter file.

trans-unit.source: For information about the template file, see <linkText>Parameter file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about the template file, see <linkText>Parameter file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: When the resource group has been deployed, you will see a summary of the deployment.
trans-unit.target: When the resource group has been deployed, you will see a summary of the deployment.

trans-unit.source: info: Executing command group deployment create
trans-unit.target: info: Executing command group deployment create

trans-unit.source: Initializing template configurations and parameters
trans-unit.target: Initializing template configurations and parameters

trans-unit.source: Creating a deployment ... info: group deployment create command OK
trans-unit.target: Creating a deployment ... info: group deployment create command OK

trans-unit.source: To get information about your latest deployment.
trans-unit.target: To get information about your latest deployment.

trans-unit.source: To get detailed information about deployment failures.
trans-unit.target: To get detailed information about deployment failures.

trans-unit.source: Set <linkText>common parameters and headers</linkText><title></title>, including authentication tokens.
trans-unit.target: Set <linkText>common parameters and headers</linkText><title></title>, including authentication tokens.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have an existing resource group, create a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have an existing resource group, create a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: Provide your subscription id, the name of the new resource group, and location that you need for your solution.
trans-unit.target: Provide your subscription id, the name of the new resource group, and location that you need for your solution.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Create a resource group</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Create a resource group</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Create a new resource group deployment.
trans-unit.target: Create a new resource group deployment.

trans-unit.source: Provide your subscription id, the name of the resource group to deploy, the name of the deployment, and the location of your template.
trans-unit.target: Provide your subscription id, the name of the resource group to deploy, the name of the deployment, and the location of your template.

trans-unit.source: For information about the template file, see <linkText>Parameter file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about the template file, see <linkText>Parameter file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the REST API to create a resource group, see <linkText>Create a template deployment</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the REST API to create a resource group, see <linkText>Create a template deployment</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Get the status of the template deployment.
trans-unit.target: Get the status of the template deployment.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Get information about a template deployment</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Get information about a template deployment</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you use a parameter file to pass the parameter values to your template during deployment, you'll need to create a JSON file with a format similar to the following example.
trans-unit.target: If you use a parameter file to pass the parameter values to your template during deployment, you'll need to create a JSON file with a format similar to the following example.

trans-unit.source: The size of the parameter file cannot be more than 64 KB.
trans-unit.target: The size of the parameter file cannot be more than 64 KB.
